newsitem.title: SPAIN: Iberdrola sees 97 profit in line with trend.
newsitem.headline: Iberdrola sees 97 profit in line with trend.

text.p: Spanish utility Iberdrola said it expected 1997 profit to be in line with the trend of the previous years.

"The recovery of demand in recent weeks and the containment of operating expenses, together with an already provisioned plan of early retirement and the greater contribution to profits of group companies will permit Iberdrola to maintain 1997 profits in line with the tendency of recent years," executive vice president Javier Herrero said in a company statement.
Iberdrola had net profit of 96.64 billion pesetas in 1996, a rise of 13.7 percent on the previous year.
On Saturday, shareholders also approved a 7.7 percent rise in the dividend to 70 pesetas a share.
